greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation of natural numbers: a(1) = 1, a(prime(n)) = lucky(1+a(n)), a(composite(n)) = unlucky(a(n)), where prime(n) = n-th prime number A000040, composite(n) = n-th composite number A002808 and lucky = A000959, unlucky = A050505.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..6185
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: As a composition of other permutations:
xref: Related or similar permutations: A246377, A255421, A257726, A257733.
Differs from A257733 for the first time at n=19, where a(19) = 63, while A257733(19) = 203.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 06 2015
